text: The 1959-60 Austrian Cup was Austria's nationwide football cup competition. Wiener AC were the defending champions. 50 teams played in the competition *14 clubs from the Staatsliga * 13 clubs of the Regionalliga Ost * 11 clubs of the Regionalliga Mitte * 6 clubs of the regional associations Salzburg, Tirol and Vorarlberg (2 each) * 6 clubs of the regional associations Vienna, Lower Austria, Burgenland, Upper Austria, Styria and Carinthia (1 each) Austrian soccer ==Preliminary round == *First round with teams from the Second league Austria Lustenau decided not to compete in the replay match scheduled for March 30, 1960 in Innsbruck. == First round == First round with top division teams The game was played on April 2nd, 1960 and canceled in the 49th minute with a score of 0:1 due to referee threat after disallowing a goal for Fohnsdorf. == Round of 16 == *Replay matches: The game was stopped in the 105th minute due to darkness and not counted. *Second replay match: == Quarter-finals == ==Semi-finals == == Final == *FK Austria Wien: Paul Schweda - Oskar Fischer - Norbert Krasa - Johann Löser - Adolf Blutsch - Erich Medveth - Franz Pfeiffer - Johann Riegler - Horst Nemec - Ernst Fiala - Walter Schleger coach: Karl Schlechta * SK Rapid Wien: Josef Eder - Paul Halla - Walter Glechner - Wilhelm Zaglitsch - Lothar Bilek - Karl Gießer - Stefan Zajic - Walter Skocik - Robert Dienst - Rudolf Flögl - Josef Bertalan coach: Robert Körner == References == Category:Austrian Cup Category:1960 in European football Category:1959 in association football
title: 1959–60 Austrian Cup
